item.title: 格兰霍姆称对中国汽车征收新关税对美国汽车业至关重要
item.description: 美国能源部长詹妮弗-格兰霍姆（Jennifer Granholm）周二表示，拜登政府计划将中国电动汽车的进口关税提高四倍至100%以上，这对美国汽车行业的健康发展至关重要。【原文：U.S. Energy Secretary Jennifer Granholm said on Tuesday the Biden administration's plan to quadruple import duties on Chinese electric vehicles to over 100% is crucial to the health of the U.S. auto sector.】

item.title: 谷歌隐私主管离职
item.description: Alphabet 旗下谷歌公司的一位发言人周二表示，谷歌首席隐私官基思-恩莱特（Keith Enright）将于今年秋天离职，此前他已在这家科技巨头工作了 13 年。【原文：Google's chief privacy officer, Keith Enright, will leave the company this fall, after 13 years at the tech giant, a spokesperson for the Alphabet-owned company said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 人工智能需求强劲，惠普企业第三季度营收超预期
item.description: 惠普企业公司周二预测第三季度营收高于华尔街预期，受助于人工智能服务器的乐观需求，其股价在延时交易中上涨了 11%。【原文：Hewlett Packard Enterprise forecast third-quarter revenue above Wall Street expectations on Tuesday, helped by upbeat demand for its artificial intelligence servers, sending its shares up 11% in extended trading.】

item.title: FTX 寻求阻止针对内部人士和风险投资公司的外部诉讼
item.description: FTX 周二要求美国法官停止针对公司内部人士和风险投资公司的外部诉讼，这些人被指控在这家破产的加密货币交易所的倒闭中扮演了角色，并称这些诉讼破坏了 FTX 自身偿还客户的努力。【原文：FTX on Tuesday asked a U.S. judge to stop outside litigation against company insiders and venture capital firms accused of playing a role in the bankrupt crypto exchange's collapse, saying the lawsuits undermine FTX's own effort to repay customers.】

item.title: SpaceX 的下一次星际飞船测试获得 FAA 批准
item.description: 美国联邦航空管理局周二表示，已为SpaceX公司的 "星际飞船 "火箭系统第四次飞行颁发了许可证，这是该公司在建造可重复使用的卫星发射器和月球着陆器的道路上进行的又一次测试任务。【原文：The U.S. Federal Aviation Administration on Tuesday said it issued a license for SpaceX's fourth flight of its Starship rocket system, another test mission along the company's path to building a reusable satellite launcher and moon lander.】

item.title: 阿波罗全球将为英特尔爱尔兰工厂提供 110 亿美元资金
item.description: 阿波罗全球管理公司（Apollo Global Management）的关联公司将向英特尔提供 110 亿美元，用于购买爱尔兰一家在建生产设施相关合资实体的 49% 股权。【原文：Apollo Global Management's affiliates will provide $11 billion to Intel to buy 49% equity interest in a joint venture entity related to an under-construction manufacturing facility in Ireland.】

item.title: 美国参议员曼钦称鼓励企业就电动汽车税收抵免问题起诉财政部
item.description: 美国参议员乔-曼钦（Joe Manchin）周二表示，他正敦促美国公司就财政部根据《通货膨胀削减法》（IRA）为公司获得清洁能源税收抵免所制定的本地含量规则提起诉讼。【原文：U.S. Senator Joe Manchin on Tuesday said he was urging U.S. companies to sue the Treasury Department over the local content rules it has set for companies to receive clean energy tax credits under the Inflation Reduction Act (IRA).】

item.title: Netflix 与中央公园五人组检察官就诽谤诉讼达成和解
item.description: Netflix 的律师周二表示，Netflix 已就畅销书作家、前曼哈顿检察官琳达-法尔斯汀（Linda Fairstein）在 2019 年一部关于中央公园五人案的犯罪剧中对她的描述而提起的诽谤诉讼达成和解。【原文：Netflix has settled a defamation lawsuit brought by best-selling author and former Manhattan prosecutor Linda Fairstein over her portrayal in a 2019 crime drama about the Central Park Five case, its lawyers said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 特斯拉今年可能斥资 30 亿至 40 亿美元购买英伟达硬件
item.description: 特斯拉公司首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）周二在 X 网站上发表文章称，特斯拉今年可能将斥资 30 亿至 40 亿美元购买芯片公司英伟达（Nvidia）的硬件。【原文：Tesla will likely spend between $3 billion and $4 billion on purchases of chip company Nvidia's hardware this year, CEO Elon Musk said in a post on X on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美国众议院议员要求了解波音质量计划全文
item.description: 众议院交通与基础设施委员会的头号民主党人周二表示，立法者希望获得波音公司提交给联邦航空管理局的完整的全面质量改进计划。【原文：Lawmakers want access to Boeing's full comprehensive quality improvement plan delivered to the Federal Aviation Administration, the top Democrat on the House Transportation and Infrastructure committee said Tuesday.】

item.title: 美国就业市场在漫长而奇特的回归大流行前正常状态的旅程中迎来里程碑
item.description: 美国就业市场在 4 月份扫清了从 COVID-19 大流行中缓慢回归的一个关键障碍，被称为 "贝弗里奇曲线 "的古怪经济图表完成了自己的旅程，从健康危机期间的位置转移回到了 2018 年至 2019 年的位置。【原文：The U.S. job market in April cleared a key hurdle in its slow return from the COVID-19 pandemic when a wonky economic chart known as the "Beveridge Curve" finished its own journey from where it had shifted during the health crisis back to where it was in 2018 to 2019.】

item.title: 墨西哥、南非和印度为市场注入政治活力
item.description: 南非、墨西哥甚至印度的重量级市场在最近几天遭受重创，毫无疑问地证明了政治仍能给大型新兴经济体带来意想不到的上勾拳。【原文：A clobbering for South Africa's, Mexico's and even India's heavyweight markets in recent days has proved without doubt that politics can still deliver an unexpected uppercut in big emerging economies.】

item.title: GameStop 疯狂上演：备忘录股票狂潮的关键里程碑
item.description: 随着社交媒体影响力人物 "咆哮的凯蒂猫 "基思-吉尔（Keith Gill）的回归，游戏拓扑（GameStop）在沉寂三年后重回人们的视线，基思-吉尔是 2021 年由 Reddit 推动的 "备忘录股票 "热潮中的关键人物。【原文：GameStop is back in the limelight after a hiatus of three years with the return of social media influencer "Roaring Kitty" Keith Gill, a key figure in the Reddit-driven "meme stock" rally of 2021.】

item.title: 酒店首席执行官称，美国商务旅行又回来了，但看起来有所不同
item.description: 在本周纽约举行的一次行业会议上，酒店高管们表示，商务旅行已经重返美国，因为各种规模的公司越来越多地以高于大流行病前的水平和价格预订旅行。【原文：Business travel has returned to the United States, hotel executives at a New York industry conference said this week, as companies of all sizes are increasingly booking trips at higher levels and prices than before the pandemic.】

item.title: Stellantis 预计意大利工厂将在 2030 年实现满负荷运转
item.description: Stellantis 首席执行官卡洛斯-塔瓦雷斯（Carlos Tavares）周二表示，由于包括混合动力车型在内的新车型计划有望支持生产，Stellantis 预计其意大利工厂将在 2030 年实现满负荷运转。【原文：Stellantis sees its Italian plants running at full capacity in 2030 as plans for new models, including hybrid ones, are expected to support production, Chief Executive Carlos Tavares said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 花旗银行新任主管拉加万上任，首席执行官盛赞其工作强度
item.description: 花旗集团周二表示，Viswas Raghavan 已于本周加入花旗集团，成为该集团在纽约的新任银行业务负责人，花旗集团今年从摩根大通聘请了这位前投资银行业务负责人。【原文：Viswas Raghavan joined Citigroup as its new head of banking this week in New York, the lender said on Tuesday, after it hired the former head of investment banking from JPMorgan this year.】

item.title: 美国联合航空公司因波音延误削减 2024 年招聘计划
item.description: 美国联合航空公司一位高管周二表示，由于波音公司推迟交付飞机，该公司今年招聘的员工人数将少于预期。【原文：United Airlines will hire fewer-than-expected employees this year due to delays in aircraft deliveries from Boeing , a company executive said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 航空公司与能源公司就绿色燃料供应发生冲突
item.description: 周二，航空公司和能源公司在替代燃料供应稀缺的问题上发生了冲突，因为航空公司在结束为期三天的峰会时，正竭力将接近创纪录的需求与供应链问题和实现环保目标的压力结合起来。【原文：Airlines and energy firms clashed over scarce availability of alternative fuels on Tuesday as carriers ended a three-day summit struggling to square near-record demand with supply chain problems and pressure to meet environmental goals.】

item.title: 香橼研究公司的 Left 在 GameStop 遭到挤压 3 年多后抛空该公司
item.description: 香橼研究公司（Citron Research）创始人安德鲁-勒夫（Andrew Left）再次押注散户投资者的最爱 GameStop，该公司在超级大牛 "咆哮的小猫 "基思-吉尔（Keith Gill）沉寂三年后再次出现在网络上后，再次成为人们关注的焦点。【原文：Andrew Left, the founder of Citron Research, is again betting against retail investors' favorite GameStop , which is back in the limelight after super-bull "Roaring Kitty" Keith Gill resurfaced online following a three-year hiatus.】

item.title: 黑人工人起诉通用磨坊在佐治亚州工厂的歧视行为
item.description: 八名黑人员工起诉通用磨坊公司，指控该食品公司在亚特兰大郊区的一家工厂几十年来一直容忍由被称为 "老好人"（Good Ole Boys）的白人经理领导的种族主义。【原文：General Mills has been sued by eight Black employees who accused the food company of tolerating decades of racism at a suburban Atlanta plant led by white managers known as the Good Ole Boys.】

item.title: 思科启动 10 亿美元人工智能基金并进行首批投资
item.description: 思科（Cisco）周二启动了一项10亿美元的基金，投资人工智能初创企业，加入了急于参股小型人工智能公司的大型科技公司行列。【原文：Cisco on Tuesday launched a $1 billion fund to invest in artificial intelligence startups, joining a list of big technology companies rushing to take stakes in small AI firms.】

item.title: 聚焦：特斯拉的早期支持者们正在放弃这只股票
item.description: 特斯拉的一些机构股东正在退出，因为他们相信，这家电动汽车制造商令人眼花缭乱的增长日子已经成为过去。【原文：Some of Tesla's institutional shareholders are getting out, convinced that the electric carmaker's days of dizzying growth are in the rear-view mirror.】

item.title: 马萨诸塞州监管机构调查 "咆哮凯蒂猫 "的 GameStop 交易
item.description: 马萨诸塞州证券监管机构正在调查 GameStop 投资者基思-吉尔（Keith Gill）的交易活动，他在 2021 年备忘录股票热潮中作为股票影响者 "咆哮的小猫 "而声名狼藉。【原文：The Massachusetts securities regulator is probing the trading activities of GameStop investor Keith Gill, who gained notoriety as stocks influencer "Roaring Kitty" during the 2021 meme stock frenzy.】

item.title: 纽约证券交易所美国期权解决市场数据技术问题
item.description: 纽约证券交易所美国期权部周二表示，该公司已解决了一个专有市场数据问题，该问题影响了一个交易单元的一个子集符号约 15 分钟。【原文：NYSE American Options said on Tuesday it had resolved a proprietary market data issue that had impacted a subset of symbols on a trading unit for about 15 minutes.】

item.title: 俄罗斯两家最大银行将于 7 月前在乌克兰被吞并地区开业
item.description: 俄罗斯储蓄银行（Sberbank）和俄罗斯外贸银行（VTB）负责人周二表示，俄罗斯最大的两家银行预计将于 7 月在莫斯科声称于 2022 年吞并的乌克兰地区开设分行和办事处。【原文：Russia's two largest banks expect to open branches and offices in July in the regions of Ukraine that Moscow claimed to have annexed in 2022, the heads of Sberbank and VTB said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美国 4 月份职位空缺降幅超过预期
item.description: 美国 4 月份的职位空缺降幅超过预期，达到三年多来的最低点，这表明劳动力市场状况正在走软，可能有助于美联储对抗通胀。【原文：U.S. job openings fell more than expected in April to the lowest in more than three years, a sign that labor market conditions are softening in a manner that could help the Federal Reserve's fight against inflation.】

item.title: 航空公司关注乱流数据，但对更多安全带限制望而却步
item.description: 据全球航空机构国际航空运输协会（IATA）称，在最近几周发生了两起抢占头条的事件后，航空公司对湍流预测技术表现出了更大的兴趣，但仍未要求乘客始终系好安全带。【原文：Airlines are showing more interest in turbulence prediction technology after two headline-grabbing incidents in recent weeks, but are holding back from making passengers stay in seatbelts at all times, according to global airline body IATA.】

item.title: 特斯拉德国工厂六月停产五天
item.description: 电动汽车制造商特斯拉（Tesla）的一位发言人周二表示，特斯拉位于格鲁恩海德（Gruenheide）的德国工厂将于 6 月份停产五天，以改进柏林郊外工厂的生产流程。【原文：Electic vehicle maker Tesla will stop production at its German plant in Gruenheide for five days in June to improve processes in the factory outside Berlin, a spokesperson said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 福特 5 月美国汽车销量增长 11
item.description: 福特汽车公司周二称，受SUV、皮卡和混合动力车需求强劲的推动，5月份美国汽车销量同比增长11%。【原文：Ford Motor Co said on Tuesday its U.S. auto sales rose 11% in May from a year earlier, helped by a healthy demand for SUVs, pickup trucks and hybrid vehicles.】

item.title: 兴登堡研究公司持有 Axos Financial 的空头头寸
item.description: 做空机构兴登堡研究公司（Hindenburg Research）周二做空 Axos Financial，称该银行承销标准不严，贷款组合存在明显问题，导致其股价在盘前交易中下跌 14%。【原文：Short seller Hindenburg Research on Tuesday took a short position in Axos Financial , alleging lax underwriting standards and glaring issues with the bank's loan portfolio, sending its shares down 14% in premarket trading.】
